Léleg sala á PS2? Ekki samkvæmt þessu:
Sony Hits 10 Million!
It took Sony five years to hit 70 million PSOnes shipped worldwide. Today, Sony hit 10 million PS2s in its first year.
Today, Sony Computer Entertainment, Inc. issued a press release announcing the company had reached an aggressive sales objective in spite of start-up hassles and parts-supply issues. With only one year separating Sony from its initial PS2 launch in Japan until today, the company has already shipped 10 million units to worldwide store shelves.
The press release contained a territorial breakdown of units shipped. According to Sony, they have to date shipped 4.65 million units to Japan, 2.76 million units to North America, and 2.63 million units to Europe/PAL territories.
This is especially impressive considering the timeframes Sony has had since each launch. While the PS2 is a bit over a year old in Japan (it launched on March 4, 2000), the PS2 is only about five months old in North America (launching on October 26, 2000) and only four months old in Europe (launching on November 24, 2000).
By comparison, it took Sony three years to ship 10 million units of the original PlayStation worldwide, proving the company is meeting a much more aggressive timetable than it faced five years ago. Despite building a new fabrication plant from scratch to manufacture the Emotion Engine and Graphic Synthesizer chips that power PS2, and various hardware shortages that led Sony to cut its initial launch-day shipments in both North America and Europe, the company is actually manufacturing PS2s three times faster than they did the PSOne.
Yet, not content to rest on their achievements to date in the face of forthcoming competition from X-Box and GameCube, Sony also announced their goal for the next year, which is to double production of PS2, to acheive an additional 20 million units shipped worldwide by this time next year. At least 15 million of those are expected to ship before Christmas 2001. That means Sony could achieve a worldwide installed base of 25 million units by the end of 2001 at a time when X-Box and GameCube are just getting out of the starting blocks.

Ömm, lastu þetta vandlega? Ég vissi allt um þetta 10.000.000 shipments dót, en það er einmitt það: Shipments. Þeir eru ekki enn búnir að SELJA 10 milljónir eintaka, enda eru flestar þessara tölva geymdar í stórum vörugeymslum og gámum, ekki enn á lager. Og Sony tapa á hverri einustu PS2 sölu, enda beita þeir tækni sem er ekki ósvipuð þeirri sem að Nintendo gerði með NES. Þeir sem að vilja vita um hana geta leitað frekari upplýsinga annarsstaðar. Það tæki of langan tíma að útlista allt hér.
Það væri góð hugmynd að kynna sér hlutina fyrst, og síðan þykjast vera gáfnaljós.

Jæja, ég rakst líka á þessa grein á netinu:
PS2 Sells 10 Million
Sony has confirmed that the PlayStation 2 console has smashed through the 10 million units sold mark in its first year at retail. Not only this, but the firm has made some quite surprising predictions for 2002.
Official figures released today show that Japan took receipt of 4.65 million units, the United States took 2.76 million, and Europe, often regarded as the lame end of video games took 2.63 million units, despite receiving the console a full month after the Americans.
For the mathematically challenged, that totals 10.4 million. If this wasn`t enough, Sony has seemingly disregarded the fact that Nintendo has just released the Game Boy Advance (which is predicted to ship 24 million in its first year) and are just about to launch the GameCube just before the Microsoft Xbox hits the world market.
Many critics rubbished Sony`s sales predictions because the PS2 has a distinct lack of high quality games - but we guess that including DVD playback in the system was the masterstroke that saved SCE`s bacon. Roll on 2002.
